page.title: 04TRANSPORT
page.content: {THE A607 LINCOLN/GRANTHAM TRUNK ROAD {RUNS N/S, CROSSED BY 3 LOCAL ROADS { THROUGH VILLAGES.} {PUBLIC TRANSPORT:}Along{A607,}1/3 mile from villages, good hourly National bus service on weekdays,twice Sundays. Private bus service to Boston and Lincoln markets. Free weekly service to Lincoln Supermarket. {PRIVATE CARS:}75% own cars, 10% have two. Taxis hired from Waddington. {CYCLING/WALKING:}Harmston people turn towards Waddington local shopping facilities,Coleby people to Navenby. A607 footpath used for cycling and walking, the traffic thundering by. {DELIVERIES:}Vans from butcher, pork butcher, fishmonger, grocer & green- grocer make eight visits weekly. {RAILWAY:}Harmston station opened 1867, closed 1963. Line closed 1965.
